Operationalizing Breakthroughs

operationalizing breakthroughs

using lean and agile design, development and management practices

What will it take?

assess the situation

In our experience, effective engagements start with an assessment of the teams, including top-level decision makers, their ecosystem, and the user and customer experience. We begin with assessment because of our strong belief in the value of listening and observing before acting.

how do we build?

engineer with quality

With strong background in software delivery, we have a natural affiliation to helping our clients with their projects. Our preference is to co-source small teams with our clients with full lifecycle covered from backlog to working software.

What will work?

co-create with network

Design P1

Design P2

How do we execute?

Lead for excellence

We have experience with small 25 person shops and development organizations that are thousands of person strong. There have been occasions when we have been asked to transform an organization, which we have. We strive to create a harmonious ecosystem that has wide support and sponsorship.

We create mechanisms that are easy to sustain after we depart. Hence, we operate in high-touch mode with the teams and yet aspire to design self-reliance in the system.

What do we change?

Transform through learning

Coaching is focused on methods, mindset, and media that teams and management need to be successful in Agile software delivery. We strive to build a culture of frontloaded quality, developing software with a cadence that delivers effective and impactful software that makes the difference with both users and stakeholders. Effective coaching has been a mix of education and hands-on partnering with teams. This allows us to set expectations with the participants and then model the Agile behaviors in context with effective practices.

We offer trainings for Certified Scrum Master (CSM) and Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) affiliated by the Scrum Alliance.

meet our team

experienced and approachable

rajeev singh

Self-described Unruly Agilist. Challenges Agile's orthodoxy and dogma. Passionate about setting up teams that accelerate change and improve effectiveness. Strong consulting background with companies such as ThoughthWorks.

greg smith

20 plus years in software leadership positions such as Chief Software Architect for RosettStone, and Principal at ThoughtWorks. Scrum Certified Trainer offering CSM and CSPO classes in US, India, Singapore, and Hong Kong.

yujun liang

15 plus years of software development as Agile Developer/Architect/Coach in US, Australia, and Singapore. Strong pedigree including ThoughtWorks. Specialist coach in TDD, BDD, and Selenium automation. Author of Selenium Capsules.

linda francis

20 plus years as designer of consumer and employee facing systems. Advises startups. Facilitates systemic changes that will evolve corporations to operate cross-functionally. Linda wants to help people in the Knowledge Age where we are today.

dennis britton

Introduced an agile, playful and productive culture to HP, Macy's, Sephora, Visa, Nike and Stella Dot. Utilizes games as positive and powerful ways to respond to change. Emergence of value-delivering teams and business systems makes him smile.

aaron boyarsky

dima kovalenko

Over 10 years in testing at ThoughtWorks, Groupon, and many others. Support to Ruby, Java, iOS, Android, and PHP projects as an automated tested and software developer. Author of Selenium Design Patterns and Best Practices.
